channel.title: Eclipseguy.com – Eclipse Chasing, Solar Eclipse Videos, Trip Reports, Galleries
channel.description: The Canadian Eclipse Chaser's home base on the internet

item.title: Hooked On The Shadow
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: HOTS is my documentary film that examines the profound experience of witnessing a total eclipse, and introduces us to the world of eclipse chasing - one of the most obsessive sub-cultures of our time. And now - to commemorate the 12th anniversary of the Caribbean eclipse of 26 February 1998, where I began filming this documentary - you can see the entire film right here.
item.excerpt:encoded: Meet the eclipse chasers! Watch the complete film right here!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/3246075" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/hots_thumb2.jpg

item.title: Eclipseguy in the news in Australia!
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: Watch me on the news in South Australia talking about the Moon's shadow over Lyndhurst on December 4, 2002.
item.excerpt:encoded: Catch me on the news in Australia!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/3339418" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/lyndhurst_news_vid.jpg

item.title: Totality in Turkey 1999
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: Thanks to NASA's public service, these images of the Total Eclipse from Turkey in 1999 show great chromosphere and a few stunning moments of the inner corona. Check it out! No audio on this one.
item.excerpt:encoded: Great shots of the corona courtesy of NASA!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/3338992" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/nasa_turkey_vid.jpg

item.title: The Big One 1991
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: The Total Eclipse of 1991 over Hawaii, Mexico and Central America was considered "The Big One" because the duration of totality was one of the longest of the 20th century. This eclipse is also considered to be the one that launched the modern day phenomenon known as "eclipse chasing" when in fact people have been flocking to see Total Solar Eclipses for centuries. Famous Canadian eclipse photographer Andreas Gada shot this 16mm film from Baja California. It don't get no betta!!! Sweeeet!!!
item.excerpt:encoded: Sweet 16mm eclipse film from The Big One!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/3271641" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/baja91_vid_thumb.jpg

item.title: 16mm Eclipse film from 1980
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: Follow the handy-work of famous Canadian eclipse chaser Andreas Gada as he opens the iris on the Total Eclipse of 1980 in Voi, Kenya. This is some of the only 16mm eclipse film you will ever see! Killer!
item.excerpt:encoded: More sweet 16mm film from 1980!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/3271070" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/kenya80_vid_thumb.jpg

item.title: The Umbra Retreats in Aruba
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: Watch the change in light on the beach as the Moon's shadow departs our location at Baby Beach in Aruba in 1998.
item.excerpt:encoded: Watch the Umbra retreat in Aruba in 1998.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/3270300" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/aruba_retreat_vid.jpg

item.title: Antarctica Total Eclipse 2003
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: My friend Jim Huddle shot this amazing footage of the Total Eclipse in Antarctica in November 2003. From his location, the eclipse happened right on the horizon making this eclipse unique in the experience of eclipse chasers. I was in Antarctica as well for this one, but at a different location. Together, we were among the first humans to witness a Total Eclipse from Antarctica.
item.excerpt:encoded: It looks fake but this is real!!!! Totality in Antarctica.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/3269907" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/huddle_vid_thumb.jpg

item.title: Shadow On The Silk Road
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded:
Eclipse in China - 01 August 2008. This is only a preview of the complete film which I have not finished yet! But the eclipse sequence is so dramatic I want to share it now. The clouds that threatened to eclipse the eclipse actually provided an ideal platform under which to observe the full motion of the umbra through the sky. Stunning! Can you spot the lightning on the horizon? It strikes three times during the eclipse.
Don't miss the time-lapse version of this shot as well, "Umbral Action."
item.excerpt:encoded: Total Eclipse with lightning on the horizon in China 2008!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/4188751" width="460" height="259" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/silk-road-new-thumb.jpg

item.title: Umbral Action!
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: In this fast-motion, wide-angle shot of the eclipse in Yiwu, China, in 2008, we can clearly see the shadow of the Moon sweep across the Earth towards us - bathe us in its unearthly light - then sweep away from us at over 3000 kilometers per hour. You rarely get to see umbral action like this! Spine-tingling!
item.excerpt:encoded: Watch the umbra move across Earth!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/4191348" width="460" height="259" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/umbral_action_vid.jpg

item.title: Africa Diamonds
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: The "Diamond Ring" phase of a Total Eclipse signals the beginning of totality, and the end of totality. You get two Diamond Rings every eclipse! Watch both in this clip from the Total Eclipse in Zambia, Africa in 2001.
item.excerpt:encoded: Watch two Diamond Rings in Zambia, Africa in 2001.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/3256816" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/africa_diamond_vid.jpg

item.title: Shadowdance
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: In this clip from the Total Eclipse of December 2002 in the Outback, I have modified the speed and contrast in order to accentuate the movement of the Moon's shadow across the Earth. You don't get to see the Moon's umbra move like this everyday! Thanks to Klipsi for sharing his killer video.
item.excerpt:encoded: Killer animation of the Moon's shadow sweeping through the sky!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/3256702" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/shadowdance_vid.jpg

item.title: Eclipsed Sun Sets!
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: In the Australian Outback in 2002, the Total Eclipse happened just before sunset. When the Sun hit the western horizon, the Moon was still in the way! This was a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Thanks to Klipsi for sharing his killer video.
item.excerpt:encoded: Watch an eclipsed sun set!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/3256490" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/eclipsedsun_sets_vid.jpg

item.title: Totality
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: This is my short documentary film about my life as an eclipse chaser. The film takes us to five solar eclipses on five continents in five minutes. It took over eight years to make! Seeking financing to make the 2-hour version! Anyone? For maximum value, turn up the speakers and go full-screen by clicking the arrows in the bottom right of the video.
item.excerpt:encoded: Total Eclipses on five continents in five minutes! Great short! Turn up the speakers for this!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/4314205" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/totality_thumb2.jpg

item.title: The Terracotta Warriors
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: During the eclipse expedition to China in 2008, we passed through the city of Xi'an and had the chance to see the famous Terracotta Warriors. More than 8,000 warriors, horses and chariots have been uncovered. They were created in 246 BC but not discovered until 1974. My invitation into the private area in the facility to film the warriors that are being repaired allowed me to get amazing, close up pictures of these sculptures.
item.excerpt:encoded: The magnificent Terracotta Warriors! Unique, behind-the-scenes footage - rarely seen like this.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/4191594" width="460" height="259" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/warriors_vid_thumb.jpg

item.title: Darkness in Turkey 1999
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: While most cameras are pointed at the sky during a Total Eclipse, the best way to get a sense of what it feels like to be there is to witness what is happening to the people on the ground. In this clip, watch as the Moon's shadow arrives, then retreats, from our observing spot - an ancient archeological site 1,000 feet above the Tigris River in Southern Turkey. So killer!
item.excerpt:encoded: One of the best ways to get a sense of a Total Eclipse is not to watch the sky... but watch the people on the ground! Daytime turns into night before your eyes!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/3246573" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/turkey_totality_vid.jpg

item.title: Malawi Safari
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: After the TSE in Zambia in June, 2001, I went on Safari in Malawi. This clip is from the half-hour film I produced about the expedition.
item.excerpt:encoded: A life-long dream to go on safari in Africa comes true in 2001. Eclipses rule.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/3246363" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/safari_vid_thumb.jpg

item.title: Tripoli & The Ruins
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: Enroute to the 2006 Total Eclipse in the Sahara Desert, eclipse chasers passed through the mystical city of Tripoli and some of the best-preserved Roman ruins in the world.
item.excerpt:encoded: Never in a million years did I ever think I would be filming in Libya at some of the best preserved ruins in the world.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/3245762" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/tripoli_vid_thumb.jpg

item.title: The Misty Eclipse
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: Chasing the century's longest Total Eclipse to Asia during the Monsoon season is risky business. Thousands of chasers across the region of totality were clouded out, while it poured rain on thousands more in Shanghai. But in the little village of Moganshan - nestled on a hill in a bamboo forest - I saw one of the most mysterious sights I have ever seen: the sky swallowing the eclipse with layer upon layer of mist. Darkest eclipse I have ever seen - and one of the coolest experiences ever.
item.excerpt:encoded: While mist and cloud can seriously diminish the corona, they don't have to kill the eclipse. See the wicked, moody film from Moganshan, China, 22 July 2009.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/misty_vid_thumb.jpg
<iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/6124847" width="460" height="259" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>

item.title: CBC Radio Canada Interview 2006
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: A lot of media interest in my eclipse chasing was created when Toro Magazine published their account of my eclipse expedition to Libya in March 2006. Cameron Phillips of CBC Radio in Vancouver called me up while I was at Burning Man that same year and invited me to speak on-air about my obsession. Along with a few photos from the archive, here is the audio from the interview in its entirety. Thanks to CBC.
item.excerpt:encoded: Eclipseguy on CBC Radio Canada in 2006 talking about what he loves best.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/cbc_radio_thumb.jpg
<iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/7496135" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>

item.title: Ice of Antarctica
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: After multiple expeditions to the ice continent - including an eclipse trip in November 2003 - I have accumulated some amazing footage of icebergs and glaciers. I couldn't resist putting together a short film dedicated to another of nature's most incredible creations - ice.
item.excerpt:encoded: If you have ever been fascinated with icebergs & glaciers - this film is for you.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/img_2154.jpg
<iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/8022606" width="460" height="259" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>

item.title: Desert Trek Sahara
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: Part of my awesome eclipse chase to Libya in 2006 included bounding over orange sand dunes in 4x4s and camping in the desert with hardened local guides. Thought you might like to see what the Sahara Desert looks like - up close.
item.excerpt:encoded: You have never seen the Sahara Desert like this.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/4751692" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/desertrek_vid_thumb.jpg

item.title: Libya Eclipse Short Film
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: Now In HD!! In 2006, eclipse chasers were treated to one of the most spectacular eclipses in recent history. In this film, The Sahara Desert in Libya provides the ultimate backdrop against which totality is observed. Best total eclipse sequence ever! I'm not trying to make you jealous! Honest! If you only ever get to see a total eclipse on the internet you haven't lived yet!
item.excerpt:encoded: This film is so killer you are crazy if you don't click on this link - at least once.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/4751374" width="460" height="259" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/libya_short_vid.jpg

item.title: Icebreaker Eclipse Antarctica 2003
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: In November 2003, I spent one month on a Russian icebreaker. Our team was the first in history to witness a Total Eclipse from the ice continent! This short film only begins to tell the story of how incredible this adventure was. And as you can see, we almost got clouded out for the eclipse!
item.excerpt:encoded: Penguins! If you aren't convinced yet that eclipse chasing can take you EVERYWHERE - then check this one out.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/4753292" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/icebreaker_vid_thumb.jpg

item.title: Eclipse on "ER"
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: As described in the Eclipse Film Database on this website, an episode of ER entitled "When Night Meets Day" employs a total solar eclipse. I've put together the relevant scenes in this short clip so you can see how the eclipse was handled. Thanks to Warner Bros./NBC
item.excerpt:encoded: Eclipses make it into the media all the time - with mixed results. Check out the eclipse in this episode of ER.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/4753909" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/er_eclipse_vid.jpg

item.title: Outback 2002
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: Flying into the middle of the Outback in Australia in a twin-prop Baron 58 with 4 friends in 2002 was one of the most outrageous eclipse chases ever! You have never seen dark skies until you have camped in the Outback! And the whopping 24 seconds of Total Eclipse was worth it all! This is adventure travel at its best.
item.excerpt:encoded: Come and fly with me into the Outback of Australia! Awesome!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/4772450" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/outback_vid_thumb.jpg

item.title: Time-Lapse Eclipse 1998
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: In this unique time-lapse film from Billy Mallery, shot in Paraguana, Venezuela, in 1998, one frame was shot every 5 seconds over a period of 6 hours. Great results!
item.excerpt:encoded: Unique time-lapse film shows the eclipse experience in a new light. Filmed in Venezuela in 1998.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/4752695" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/mallery_thumb.jpg

item.title: 2006 Eclipse Animation
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: Hundreds of still images are skillfully animated here by Canadian eclipse expert Andreas Gada, creating the only eclipse film in the world to show every phase of the eclipse. Shots taken in Jalu, Libya, 29 March 2006. Killer sequence!
item.excerpt:encoded: Curious about what an entire TSE looks like - beginning to end? Watch this unique film.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/4755025" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/gada_anim_thumb2.jpg

item.title: Discovery Channel Eclipse Special
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: On November 23, 2003 - eclipse day in Antarctica - I was the only Canadian eclipse chaser aboard the Russian icebreaker Kapitan Khlebnikov. We had positioned ourselves on the ice shelf right in the path of totality. Minutes before the eclipse began, the Discovery Channel did this interview with me by satellite phone from the bow of the ship! Awesome day!
item.excerpt:encoded: Watch my interview with Discovery Channel from the bow of the icebreaker in Antarctica!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/4907573" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/discovery_vid_thumb.jpg

item.title: Penguins of Antarctica
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: Penguins are the coolest little animals. Actually, the Emperors - made famous in film The March of the Penguins - are not that small! Our expedition came across hundreds of Emperors by accident when we stopped the ship to hike to the "blue diamond" ice berg. The shots of Adelie and Gentoo penguins are from other expeditions to the Antarctic Peninsula.
item.excerpt:encoded: On the way to the eclipse in Antarctica we saw some pretty amazing things. Penguins!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/penguin_thumb.jpg
<iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/5004725" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>

item.title: Peter Gabriel & Kate Bush "Don't Give Up"
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: This 1986 music video for Gabriel's beautiful song "Don't Give Up' was directed by Godley & Creme, the English pop music duo that began releasing albums together after splitting from the band 10cc. Musically, they were known for their ground-breaking production work. But their greatest success came as the innovative directors of more than 50 music videos in the 1980s. This video is one, long shot - and features Gabriel and Bush in a never-ending embrace as the Moon totally eclipses the Sun behind them.
item.excerpt:encoded: Is this 1986 offering from Peter Gabriel the first music video to employ a Total Eclipse?

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <object width="460" height="345"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/uiCRZLr9oRw&hl=en&fs=1&rel=0"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/uiCRZLr9oRw&hl=en&fs=1&rel=0" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true" width="460" height="345"></embed></object>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/gabriel_vid_thumb.jpg

item.title: Editors "The Racing Rats"
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: From the album An End Has a Start, set in a sterile suburbia, the members of the band Editors play while a small child draws a large chalk circle in the middle of the street and makes the Sun disappear behind the Moon - along with all the neighbourhood's inhabitants! Wins a prize for the most hard-edged filmic eclipse!
item.excerpt:encoded: As far as eclipses in music videos go, this one is pretty cool.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <object width="460" height="345"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/KpH697da4KQ&hl=en&fs=1&rel=0"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/KpH697da4KQ&hl=en&fs=1&rel=0" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true" width="460" height="345"></embed></object>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/editors_vid_thumb.jpg

item.title: TEDx Toronto
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: TEDx Conferences are independently organized TED events held in cities around the world that bring passionate speakers and presenters together in a forum to spread their ideas. In September 2009, I was asked to give a talk about what I have learned from a lifetime of chasing eclipses. "Understanding Ourselves In An Epic Universe" is the result. Lots of inspired talks on the main TED website here.
item.excerpt:encoded: My talk at the TEDx Toronto Conference in September 2009.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/9988618" width="460" height="347" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>
http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/ted_news_thumb1.jpg

item.title: Raw Video from Patagonia - 11 July 2010
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: The eclipse that almost wasn't! Freezing cold conditions - ice - snow - high winds - and a forecast of 90% overcast skies. A thrilling chase. And my first truly golden corona. Check it out!  Full trip report & pix here.
item.excerpt:encoded: Killer Raw Video from South America.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/raw_patagonia_vid.jpg
<iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/13380916" width="460" height="259" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>

item.title: Front Row Universe
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: The mystique of the desert of the American southwest hung in the air with the eclipsed sun as we chased the Annular Eclipse of May 20, 2012, south of the Grand Canyon in Arizona.  Best eclipse video ever!  Turn up the speakers and go Full Screen!
item.excerpt:encoded: Great Documentary Film. The expedition to chase the Annular eclipse in Arizona in May 2012 went spectacularly well! A must see!!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/arizona_thumb1.jpg
<iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/42812310" width="460" height="259" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>

item.title: Solar Eclipses in TV Shows
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: In the 2011 episode "Partial Eclipse of the Heart" from the TV series "Being Human," the writers employ a Total Eclipse of the Sun to super-charge the supernatural.  When the eclipse takes place - the characters are caught off guard - and the dead return to the earthly plane to confront the assailants that "shredded" them. Following in the classic mythos of eclipses, as used in the 1986 film "Ladyhawke," the few brief moments of totality creates an ethereal pocket in space and time where dearly departed lovers are given a final chance to reconnect, face to face, before facing eternity apart. As far as treatments go, there is nothing much new here.  But the nod to the classical treatment has a lot of credibility in my opinion, and the computer-generated visuals of the celestial phenomena are first rate - especially when you take into account how poorly eclipses are usually depicted in film.  Kudos to the producers. Don't miss the Eclipse Film Database on this website.  The world's only comprehensive database of eclipses in documentary and dramatic films. Being Human © All rights reserved by the producers.  Clips courtesy of BH2 Productions (Muse Entertainment) Inc., Kodiak Media, USA.
item.excerpt:encoded: TV Producers seem endlessly fascinated with solar eclipses - frequently using them as narrative devices that drive dramatic storylines. Here is a terrific example.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://eclipseguy.com/wp-content/uploads/being-human-thumb.jpg
<iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/49488145" width="460" height="259" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>

item.title: Australia Eclipse Raw Video
item.dc:creator: eclipseguy
item.content:encoded: We were supposed to be on the beach at our luxurious villa for this eclipse! But that's where all the clouds were. We ran inland - slept in our cars - and awoke to more cloud. We ran again. Our third site was perfectly clear. This is what we saw. Actual Totality observed from this location was 1:28 min.
item.excerpt:encoded: New RAW VIDEO from the chase to Queensland, Australia, November 14, 2012.
